result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Borchardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sexual Assault/Sex Organ Injury, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence. Credit for 5 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond applied to Fine and Costs.  Paid in Full.  Balance returned to Surety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Submit DNA sample.

COMPLY WITH SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY LAW.

NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM UNLESS SPECIFICALLY APPROVED BY AGENT. 

NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 18.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
